data.title: Casbah of Algiers
data.text: The Casbah qaba meaning citadel is the citadel of Algiers in Algeria and the traditional quarter clustered around it In 1992 the United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization UNESCO proclaimed Kasbah of Algiers a World Cultural Heritage Site as There are the remains of the citadel old mosques and Ottoman style palaces as well as the remains of a traditional urban structure associated with a deep rooted sense of community Etymology More generally a kasbah is the walled citadel of many North African cities and towns The name made its way into English from French in the late 19th century the Oxford English Dictionary states 1895 and can be spelled kasbah or casbah
